Key Match Events: India conceded an early seventh minute goal.
Despite creating many chances in the second half, India couldn't score.
Syria scored the second goal against the run of play in the 77th minute.
Syria scored a third goal in the 96th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: India suffered a 0-3 loss to Syria in their second and final Intercontinental Cup 2024 match.
New head coach Manolo Marquez suffered his first loss as India coach.
Marquez has neither won a game nor seen his side score a goal yet.
Post-Match Reflections: India deserved to score in the second half but couldn't due to lack of clinical finishing.
Coach Manolo Marquez acknowledged that India was scared in the first half but felt they deserved a better outcome in the second half.
The only redeeming point is that India created several chances in the second half but failed to capitalize on them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India finished last in the Intercontinental Cup 2024, behind Mauritius on goal difference.
Syria had a clinical performance and dominated India on the counter-attack.
The match ended with a 0-3 scoreline, with goals scored by Mahmoud Al-Aswad, Daleho Irandust, and Pablo Sabbag.
